Portfolio

Influencer marketing platform.

Francisco was responsible of all technical aspects of the platform, from the landing page copy & design, writing the code for the app & data crawling, UI/UX and user friendliness, to server configuration, security and testing. He was also very involved in key strategic decisions. The design & overall functionality received extremely great feedback both from companies & influencers.

Ecommerce & marketplace.

Negotiation mechanism: proposal & counter proposals.

Data crawling, storage & analytics.

Multilingual designs
for international markets.

As a designer in the second largest wine producer in South America, Isabel worked closely with marketing, product development and sales departments creating ads, promotions and packaging. Her work was printed in giant billboards, appeared in television and was printed in millions of newspapers and magazines. She also standardized internal processes for art work requirements which improved work efficiency.

Worked with big brands: Manchester United & Dallas Cowboys.

Delivered work for Africa, North America & Europe.

Implemented standardize internal systems.

Won bidding against 20+ competitors.

As a senior software developer at Unholster, Francisco was part of a 3 person team that designed and implemented a proposal for an open competition to find a solution to the increasing coordination problems they had with the more than 200 electricity producers in the country. After months of competition, they ultimately won the contract for a full fledged implementation.

Agile methodologies.

Security & infrastructure.

REST API.

Developed the soul of the brand.

When Isabel entered the company, the brand had no consistency neither in their message, voice nor graphic material. She saw the opportunity to add extra value for the customer, and as a designer & community manager, she first investigated the customer, their values, worries, socio economic background, and defined the target audience, value proposition and voice of the brand. After she finished, the brand had a defined path to go forward.

Branding.
